title: Kacey Musgraves rocks out at Austin City Limits while showing off taut tummy in a black crop top
text:
Her album Golden Hour swept the top country prizes at the Grammy Awards and earned the prestigious Album of the Year award.

Kacey Musgraves went back to her roots Sunday with her early evening performance at the Austin City Limits festival in Austin, Texas.

The 31–year–old Texas-born musician beamed ear–to–ear while performing for the crowd in a sultry black floral outfit.

Crowd favorite: Kacey Musgraves, 31, went back to her roots Sunday with an early evening performance at the Austin City Limits festival in Austin, Texas

Kacey showcased her taut tummy with her outfit, which featured a matching black crop top and high-waisted bottoms.

The items featured delicate floral stitching, and she covered up with a black blazer of the same design.

The 5ft5in singer's outfit paired nicely with her raven tresses, which cascaded down her back in light waves. She parted her hair down the middle and wore a white hair clip to accentuate it.

The pants-free outfit highlighted Kacey's trim legs, and she accessorized with two gold chains, one thick and one slim.

Back in black: Kacey showcased her taut tummy with her outfit, which featured a matching black crop top and high-waisted bottoms

Delicate fashion: The items featured delicate floral stitching, and she covered up with a black blazer of the same design

Kacey's set was heavy on tracks from last year's critically acclaimed Golden Hour, which also topped the Billboard Country charts.

She opened the show like the album with the aptly titled Slow Burn, according to Austin 360.

The singer and songwriter also threw in a song from 2015's Pageant Material, and she channeled Whitney Houston with a cover of I Wanna Dance With Somebody.

According to Austin station KVUE, much of the crowd dissipated toward the end of the set as they got ready to see Lizzo at another stage, though it doesn't seem to have disappointed Kacey, a self-confessed fan.

She asked the crowd who was planning to see Lizzo after her set, adding 'Maybe she can hear us? Let’s all yell, "Hey Lizzo!" We love you, queen!'

Blast from the past: Kacey played the bulk of her Grammy-winning 2018 album Golden Hour, along with a cover of Whitney Houston's I Wanna Dance With Somebody

Supportive artists: The self-professed fan asked the crowd who would be going to see Lizzo's set immediately after hers

Earlier this summer, Kacey got to meet another idol while celebrating her 31st birthday.

She and the ever-youthful Cher, 73, posed for a photo following a performance in Las Vegas.

'Cher’s a big style icon to me. I love her. If I can just get my abs lookin’ like hers … that would be the goal,' she told Stereogum in 2018.

'That long, straight hair, and, I don’t know, just kinda that disco vibe, it’s inspiring to me,' she continued.
description: Kacey Musgraves wowed the crowd at the Austin City Limits Festival on Sunday with selections from her Grammy-winning album Golden Hour. She gave Lizzo a shout-out from the stage.
